email.title: DoCSoc Weekly Digest
email.heading: CSP Elections
email.text:
We're entering that time again... As of tomorrow 9am the polls will open and you'll get to elect your next officers for DoCSoc, the union and all the other CSPs out there!
Make sure to vote in every election you're able to, and make your opinion heard. Voting closes Thursday 2pm.
You can vote and see manifestoes [here](https://vote.union.ic.ac.uk/)!
From this point on, we kindly ask for no campaigning at DoCSoc events. Good luck everyone!
email.heading: Bloomberg Intenrships
email.text:
Bloomberg are recruiting for Summer Intenrships and Placements:
Bloomberg software engineers develop impactful solutions to complex, real-world problems. This is no different for our interns. Engineering interns take ownership of their projects under the mentorship of full-time software engineers. We are looking for top computer science students who are passionate about technology and eager to learn in our high energy, fast-paced environment.
As an intern, you'll become an expert on the Bloomberg Terminal and gain a deeper understanding of technology and finance. In addition to your projects, you'll participate in coding challenges, attend tech talks and network with other interns.
Sign up [here](https://bloomberg.avature.net/su/311c9e01353686c8) for internships and [here](https://bloomberg.avature.net/su/cab31c279b1af0f8) for placements.
email.heading: JetBrains Intenrships
email.text:
JetBrains are recruiting for Summer Intenrships:
JetBrains is now accepting applications for internships in 2025!
We invite university students and recent graduates to apply for our wide range of paid onsite and remote internships in countries where we have R&D offices.
Work on real projects in IntelliJ IDEA, RustRover, Kotlin, and other JetBrains IDEs with top professionals and gain hands-on experience.
Apply by April 7, 2025! Create a profile, specify your university, pick up to five projects, complete the test tasks, and land a potential offer!
More information can be found at internship.jetbrains.com
You are welcome to contact us at internship@jetbrains.com with any questions or concerns!
Join our student discord at https://discord.com/invite/pRjZKJsja5
email.heading: Labs Coffee Machine is BACK!
email.text:
The coffee machine in the labs kitchen is back! The machine uses classic Nespresso pods, please bring and buy these, although we may leave a few free ones out on DoCSoc.
Please clean up if you spill coffee and use the machines and pods responsibly. Any misuse of the machine will lead to it being removed again.
email.heading: WiC x DoCSoc Breakfast

event.text:
Come join us tomorrow morning for some free breakfast and a chat!
Please note we are not allowing elections campaigning at DoCSoc events.

email.text: Every week or so we'll be showcasing a cool student society, project or event. Please email us if you want your cool society/project/event to be featured!
email.heading: CGCU x RCSU x RSM Bloom Bash

event.text:
RCSU, CGCU and RSM are teaming up to host their Bloom Bash at Ballie Ballerson. It will be neon colours theme event so make sure you are dressed to impress :) Each ticket comes with 2 drinks token and bottomless pizza! 18+ only - no government ID, no entry. Last entry is 10:30pm All tickets are non-refundable which supersedes the ICU terms of use.
Sign up [here](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/shop/cu/royal-college-science-union/rcsu-x-cgcu-bloom-bash-cgcu-tickets)

email.heading: Portico Hack - ICL x UCL x KCL CyberSoc CTF

event.text:
CyberSoc's first ever collaborative CTF with their sibling CyberSocs at UCL and KCL's :D
This will be a beginner to advanced intermediate CTF, so please feel free to come along even if this is your first CTF!
All Imperial students are welcome to join, just sign-up using [UCL's form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfHrS0gV3Lu2Nb7xkvgyyuCFU8fF5YrWOpABiMixzETPpgYqA/viewform), before rolling up on the 16th :D

email.heading: Cybersecurity Soc - The Power of Networking in Cybersecurity

event.text:
Alexandra Forsyth, a cyber security threat analyst and entrepreneur, is delivering an industry talk!
How are cyber security threats evolving? What are the key areas of industry under threat? And what is Alexandra's role in helping to curb these threats?
In preparation for the talk, please feel free to suggest anything you would like to hear discussed [here](https://forms.gle/RCs8qo1XhQQy7QAK7).

email.heading: WiC - Women at Imperial Week
email.text:
Women in Computing have got an exciting lineup of events next week to celebrate Women at Imperial Week! üë©‚Äçüíª Whether you're looking to connect, learn, or just have a great time, we've got something for you:
- üìå Monday: WiC x DoCSoc Breakfast - Start the week off right with good food and great company! ü•ê - üìå Tuesday: Sponsors Fair - Meet our sponsors, including Optiver, G-Research, and Goodnotes, and explore exciting career opportunities. üíº - üìå Wednesday: WiC x NTU Panel - Join us for an insightful discussion in collaboration with NTU. üéì - üìå Thursday: Movie Night - Chill with us for a cosy movie night! üé¨ - üìå Friday: Curly Fries Night - A classic WiC event, because everything's better with curly fries! üçü
Save the dates, and stay tuned to their instagram for more details on rooms and times which will be released closer to the time! üíñ

This will be here, at the bottom of all our digests from now on. Feel free to speak your mind regarding events DoCSoc have been running so far, and also about DoCSoc in general.
Please find the link [here](https://forms.gle/WHU127UYv8dd5zGVA)
Individual survey results will be kept private.
